definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Therefore, China becomes 'the other' in Akutagawa's discourse of orientalism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，在芥川的東方主義話語中，中國被他者化了。

sentences.english: First, the discourses of theory are heteronomous.
